title: Was Ahri and Jhin in love?
body:
In Ahri's new lore, she said that she killed a man she was in love with. She said that she loved an artist who liked to paint flowers. Sounds familiar? But what if she thought she killed him, but he actually survived but has gone crazy because of it? What if she knew it, but she killed the man he once was. If that's the case, she probably has even more guilt that she created a psychotic killer that even Shen and Zed were traumatized over.

Now for Jhin's side of the story, he probably had no memory of the experience. However, he knew he was an artist, and this near death experience made him become obsessed with death. The story said while he was in prison, he revealed nothing about his past. Maybe he doesn't know much about himself anymore.

Just a thought.

replies.body:
Timeline wise it doesn't work: 

"She grew drunk with memories that were not her own, and exhilarated in the lives of others. Through stolen visions, Ahri watched through their eyes as they pledged fealty to a temple of shadow, sacrificed offerings to a deity of the sun incarnate, encountered an avian tribe of vastaya that spoke only in song, and glimpsed mountainous landscapes unlike any she had seen. She experienced heartbreak and elation in tantalizing flashes that left her craving more, and wept at the massacres of Ionian villagers at the hands of Noxian invaders."

Ahri was struggling with her addiction before she met her lover and during the course of the Noxian Invasion. Jhin was in prison at the time.

Taking that as a given isn't it a bit strange that there are 2 ppl so similar in their criminal art creation?

Was there a sort of "school" like the ones for martial arts and such that believed that blood and homicides should be used for art purposes?
*Shrugs*. Runeterra's a big place, so I don't see it as being that off that people with similar mindsets, even when we're talking about murderers.
True that, I just think that there are too many things in common.

Question: Is that an official no or a speculating no?  

Asking because I've been working on a few theories, and the timeline gets a bit cramped if those memories are from the Noxian invasion.  As I understand it, it would mean Ahri's guilt trip, meeting the artist, killing him, wiping out a village, disappearing, then reappearing in control all happened during the invasion, a strange time for an artist to visit, or after it.  If after, with Kayn being a child soldier in the invasion's first wave, the events would have to be rather close together, as he doesn't seem significantly old.    

I was thinking that, with Ionia's relative lack of dedicated military power, periodic Noxian raiding parties wouldn't be unreasonable, and would fall under the scope of the term invader even without being in  _the _ invasion.  This would also mesh with the Vastaya journal's mention of a family avoiding Ahri for generations, which otherwise stretches the timeline oddly. It seems to mean she spent decades hunting people down, then the invasion happened and she rapidly goes from bad to good, to oversimplify.  

If it's officially wrong and I'm way off please tell me so I can adjust everything and stop spreading misinformation.

I didn't really know about the timeline, I was just wondering if this all probably happens before the invasion. Star Wars kinda taught me that there are almost no coincidences, and everything connects somehow. I guess that made me think about all of this. Thanks for the comment though.

So, I believe that Jhin had gone off the deep end before the Noxian invasion - Shen, Zed, and Kusho had been hunting the Golden Demon for years after all.  Ahri's first encounter with humans was apparently encountering soldiers from a foreign land of stone and iron (maybe Noxians?)

If it _was_ Noxian soldiers from the invasion that she first encountered, then Sharjo is right in that Jhin was not only imprisoned during most of the invasion, but had been a serial killer long before the invasion began.  I think it's very unlikely* that it could have been a close encounter with Ahri that 'made' Jhin the killer he is today.

That's not to say that they haven't crossed paths since his release.  Could have happened.

######*I feel there should be a more definite way to say this than 'very unlikely', but hell - Ekko and Zilean muck around with time, and gods walk amongst peasants, so who knows what's possible.
I think Jhin will have a romantic relationship with Jinx now that he is heading to Zaun with that boat.
Now that's something I'd like to see!

Speaking of Zilean, now that we know Voli is brothers with (P)Ornn, I wonder if Zilean still has some relation with Volibear or his lore will be updated with his potential VGU. I know his old lore was a meme between some Rioters but they have some Unique interactions in game that are super cool and I hope will be kept in Volibear's VGU!

Leading in from what MKYNER said, that doesn't necessarily have to be true. Ahri's kit is also number based. Her style revolves around 3 and 9. Her passive charges 9 times, and can trigger 3 charges per spell cast per target. Her Foxfire creates 3 flames, and her ultimate is 3 dashes, each with 3 flames, that can hit up to 3 targets. (I'm not sure about the Charm math, I've never looked at it.)

Assuming Jhin did only keep certain fragmented memories, one of them could easily be an obsession with numbers. But, which numbers? Well, he knows he's an artist, and he knows he likes the lotus flower, which is based around 4's. 


It could still theoretically work.

Interesting. I've been playing so much ahri and never stopped to think about all of that. And there are two other things about 4 that has something to do with jhin's obsession. Modern music is made on a 4/4 grid, and 4 has a resemblance to death in many Asian cultures. The 4 you know! I'll show myself out.

There's also that her Q, which is the primary trigger for her 3's and 9's passive, is called the Orb of Deception. Orb is 3 and Deception is 9.

That still leaves the unknown Charm connection, if one exists, but until it's disproven...
